q: Does the driver of the blue car have to give right of way to the pedestrian?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Traffic lights

q:
The driver of this car must stop.

A. Correct.
B. Incorrect.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Qualified persons

q:
If you want to overtake this cyclist on the left outside a built up area, you have to leave a safe space in between of …

A. ... 1 meter.
B. ... 1,5 meter.
C. ... 2 meters.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Over Taking

q:
The traffic lights turn amber.
The blue car …

A. ... must always stop.
B. ... is allowed to drive past the amber lights if it can’t stop safely anymore.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Traffic lights

q:
What is the hierarchical order?

A. 1 - 2 - 3.
B. 3 - 2 - 1.
C. 3 - 1 - 2.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - Road Signs

q: Is the driver of the red car allowed to overtake the green car on the left.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - The Lanes

q:
The blue car is slowing down.
Is the grey car allowed to overtake on the left?

A. No.
B. Yes.
C. Yes, if there is no pedestrian.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Over Taking

q:
What do these cars have to do at this junction?

A. They pas each other on the right.
B. They pas each other on the left.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Crossing

q: What is the maximum speed limit in Flanders on a ordinary road? (... km/h)
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - The public road

q: On this express road in Wallonia with 2x2 lanes, a car is allowed to drive maximum (…) kph.
s: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - The Express Road

q:
A pedestrian is not using or going to use the pedestrian crossing.
Is the red car allowed to overtake the blue one on the left?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - The The pedestrians

q:
You want to test your car and you drive 167kph on this express road.

A. This is an offence and you will be fined.
B. This is an offence and your driving licence can be suspended immediately.
s: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - The Express Road

q:
The green filter arrow is lit up.
Is the driver of the blue car still allowed to cross at the junction and turn left?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Traffic lights

q: On this express road in Flanders the driver of the orange car is allowed to drive maximum (…) km/hour.
s: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - The Express Road

q:
You hear the warning bell sound, but the barriers are still completely open.

A. You are allowed to drive through.
B. You must stop.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: In a residential area or estate you are allowed to drive maximum (…) km/hour.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Special Places

q:
You drive too fast in a zone 30.
How many kph too fast is needed for the POLICE to withhold your driving licence immediately.

A. More than 20 kph to fast.
B. More than 30 kph too fast.
C. More than 40 kph too fast.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q:
A school bus has stopped and the hazard warning lights are being used. What do you have to do?

A. Stop.
B. Slow down and stop if necessary.
C. Drive on.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - The lights

q:
The driver of the brown car wants to cross at the junction.
Does he have to consider the red light?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Traffic lights

q:
The fuel of your car is LPG or petrol.
Are you allowed to drive past this sign with your car?

A. Yes.
B. No.
C. Yes, only when you switch from LPG to petrol.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - The load of passengers

q:
If you want to overtake this cyclist on the left outside a built up area, you have to leave a safe space in between of …

A. ... 1 meter.
B. ... 1,5 meter.
C. ... 2 meters.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Over Taking

q:
The traffic lights are out of order.
Who is allowed to cross first?

A. The moped.
B. The red car.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Qualified persons

q:
When does the speed limit apply?

A. Always.
B. Only during the school hours.
C. Only during the school hours and not on holidays.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Special Places

q:
What does this sign indicate?

A. The M.G.W.
B. The M.A.W.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Prohibited direction

q:
The driver of the black car wants to turn left.

A. He is allowed.
B. He is only allowed to drive on.
C. He must stop.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree, Qualified persons
